newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian cotton prices fall on rising new arrivals.
newsitem.headline: Indian cotton prices fall on rising new arrivals.

text.p: Indian cotton prices fell on Friday on low mill demand and rising new crop arrivals, dealers said.
"New crop arrivals were low at the producing centres upto last week Diwali festivals but now arrivals are picking up," one dealer said.

In spot deals Bengal-deshi fell by 10/15 rupees to 900/930 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) while Punjab saw-ginned moved down by 15/20 to 1,575/1,660. Gujarat Sankar-4 (long-staple) fell to 18,300/19,500 rupees per candy (355.56 kg) from 18,800/19,800.
"Mill buying was low due to a financial crunch," he said.
